ingredients: 1 kg mutton or chicken, bone-in pieces
1/2 teaspoon saffron strands soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk

steps.title: Prepare Marinade
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, salt, and lemon juice.

steps.title: Marinate the Meat
steps.description: Add the mutton or chicken pieces to the marinade. Mix well and let it rest for at least 1-2 hours in the refrigerator.

steps.title: Prepare Potatoes
steps.description: Peel and cut potatoes in halves. Rinse and pat them dry.

steps.title: Fry Potatoes
steps.description: Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the potato halves until golden brown. Remove and set aside.

steps.title: Heat Oil and Fry Whole Spices
steps.description: In a large pot, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, and bay leaf. Fry for 30-40 seconds until fragrant.

steps.title: Add and Fry Onions
steps.description: Add sliced onions to the pot. Fry them on medium heat until deep golden brown, stirring occasionally.

steps.title: Cook Tomatoes
steps.description: Add chopped tomatoes to the browned onions. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture thickens.

steps.title: Add Marinated Meat
steps.description: Add the marinated meat along with all the marinade to the pot. Stir well to combine with the onion-tomato base.

steps.title: Cook Meat Until Tender
steps.description: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until tender and oil separates from the masala. Add water as needed during cooking.

steps.title: Add Powdered Spices
steps.description: Mix in coriander powder and garam masala powder. Cook for a few more minutes to deepen the flavor.

steps.title: Add Fried Potatoes and Herbs
steps.description: Add the fried potatoes, chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, and slit green chilies. Stir gently to blend.

steps.title: Rinse and Soak Rice
steps.description: Rinse the basmati rice in water 2-3 times. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

steps.title: Boil Water for Rice
steps.description: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add salt generously.

steps.title: Cook Rice Partially
steps.description: Add soaked rice to boiling water. Cook until 70-80% done. Drain and keep aside.

steps.title: Start Layering
steps.description: In a large heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the cooked rice at the bottom.

steps.title: Add Meat Mixture
steps.description: Spread the cooked meat masala with potatoes evenly over the rice layer.

steps.title: Top Final Rice Layer
steps.description: Add the remaining rice on top. Gently level it out.

steps.title: Add Final Garnish
steps.description: Drizzle saffron milk on top. Sprinkle remaining mint, coriander, and some reserved fried onions if available.

steps.title: Seal and Dum Cook
steps.description: Seal the pot with a tight-fitting lid or dough. Place on low heat and cook for 20-25 minutes for dum (steam) cooking.

steps.title: Rest and Serve
steps.description: Let the biryani rest for 10 minutes after cooking. Gently fluff and mix before serving with raita or salad.
